meanings.sent1: Their constant arguing can disharmonize the family gatherings.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party next door can disharmonize the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog seemed to disharmonize the otherwise quiet street.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected rain shower disharmonized our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The out-of-tune piano notes disharmonized the entire song.

meanings.definition: To disrupt the harmony or balance of something
meanings.sent1: Adding too much salt can disharmonize the flavors of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The construction noise outside can disharmonize the concentration of students in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The broken wheel on the bicycle disharmonized the smooth ride.
meanings.sent4: The sudden power outage disharmonized the flow of the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The conflicting schedules disharmonized the team's ability to work together.
